title: Capacitor - pd for 5x area - 3x distance - 2x k

content.question: Two parallel-plate capacitors, Capacitor <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Capacitor <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, have the same charge <math alttext="Q sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>Q</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> on their plates. The plates of Capacitor <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> each have area <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math>, are separated by a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math>, and have no material between them. The plates of Capacitor <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> each have area <math alttext="5 A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>5</mn><mi>A</mi></math>, are separated by a distance <math alttext="3 d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mi>d</mi></math>, and have a material with a dielectric constant of <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> between them. What is the potential difference across the plates of Capacitor <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> in terms of the potential difference <math alttext="delta V sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> across the plates of Capacitor <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="ten thirds times delta V sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>10</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="six fifths times delta V sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>6</mn><mn>5</mn></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="five sixths times delta V sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>5</mn><mn>6</mn></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="three tenths times delta V sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>10</mn></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="three tenths times delta V sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>10</mn></mfrac><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><msub><mi>V</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
